alert.note: Alert for Chenango; Cortland (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 18 at 5:23AM EST until December 18 at 10:00AM EST by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central New York, including the following counties, Chenango, Cortland, Delaware, Madison, Oneida, Onondaga and Otsego. * WHEN...Until 815 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 523 AM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Utica, Rome, Oneonta, Oneida, Norwich, Hamilton, Cooperstown, New Hartford, Sullivan, Lenox, Pompey, Verona, Westmoreland, Chittenango, Canastota, Manlius, Trenton, Sidney, Floyd and New York Mills. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
